items.title: Remote Senior Mobile Application Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Job Description

We are a diverse team, working remotely from all around the world, coming together to work on a mission of raising the standard of trust online. We want your help, wherever you are!

Join the Mobile team as a remote Senior Mobile Application Developer and help shape the technology that powers the DuckDuckGo search experience. DuckDuckGo is headquartered in the US, but this role is open to everyone!

As part of our growing team, you will be collaborating with team members at all levels to identify and close major gaps in our products. Examples of projects you might work on include building out and improving mobile content blocking, improving installation conversion, or running experiments to investigate and improve the usability of our mobile apps. You will be directly responsible for mobile application features, taking ownership over product maintenance, and driving improvements.

We are fully-remote and seek to empower our team to be self-directed and self-motivated in their projects. If that seems awesome and you like the idea of our core values -- build trust, question assumptions, and validate direction -- you'll fit right in!

What you will do:

  • Lead development of projects by taking vague problems, scoping them into high-impact projects, and executing them against a set of success criteria
  • Play a key role in improving the software architecture
  • Take responsibility for solving product issues - large and small.
  • Implement and/or create mobile solutions to improve apps directly.
  • Collaborate with peers on product brainstorms, technical design discussions, pair programming sessions and code reviews.
  • Write pragmatic, testable code that works consistently and is performant.

What we are looking for:

  • Significant mobile engineering experience (4+ years).
  • Expertise on iOS (cross-platform expertise is a plus!).
  • Experience working on at least one large application.
  • Effective project management skills.
  • Familiarity with MVC/MVVC concepts and how they apply to mobile applications.
  • Familiarity with mobile threading and memory management.
  • Ability to develop and use complicated data structures and algorithms. This includes understanding the fundamentals, as well as navigating and improving existing code.
  • Ability to develop effective UX solutions through user feedback loops, leveraging both quantitative and qualitative metrics.
  • Creative problem solvers and risk takers. You like to take initiative in pushing a project forward, but know when to get others involved.
  • Strong communication skills. You can validate and communicate your decisions clearly.

Other things to know:

  • We are a small, remote team in different time zones and communicate with a variety of tools throughout the day. You should feel comfortable with the intricacies of this type of work situation.
  • Sometimes we meet up! You can expect to travel at least 2x a year: once for our all-hands meetup and another for a team retreat (each ~4-5 days)
  • We want to have a major impact on raising the standard of trust online. To do this, we believe in a focused approach, with company-wide objectives, and with each team member working on a single top priority at a time.
  • Our work philosophy is built upon empowered project management. All team members have opportunities to run projects.
  • All projects are run transparently, and we encourage everyone to participate in areas of interest throughout the company. Anyone and everyone can (and should) ask questions and offer feedback around the product and internal projects.
  • We try to exemplify our values (build trust, question assumptions, and validate direction) in everything we do.

If you think you might thrive in this environment, we would love to hear from you. Use the application below to apply!

items.title: REMOTE Senior iOS Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=7, mobile=28, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=20, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Job Description

About Us:

We are a grocery delivery startup focused on delivering groceries and home essentials, we already have over 500,000 items from local stores in its catalog.

Customers can choose from a variety of local stores including Safeway, Whole Foods, Super Fresh, Harris Teeter, Shaw's, Mariano's, Jewel-Osco, Stanley's and Costco. Additionally, customers can mix items from multiple stores into one order.

We have over 200 employees and a $4B valuation and are looking for a driven, talented iOS developer to join our team. If this sounds like you, please apply today!

Responsibilities:

  • Executing a variety of projects to extend and enhance our application for iPhone and iPad
  • Building new features to create an experience nothing short of magical

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science is preferred with 8+ years of software development experience and at least 5 years of iOS app development experience
  • Very strong development skills in Swift or Objective C, iOS SDK, and good general programming and algorithm skills
  • Superior analytical skills and a strong sense of urgency and ownership in your work
  • Proven customer facing application development, troubleshooting, deployment, and application performance tuning experience
  • Proven ability to build, launch and iterate on apps under pressure
  • Previous experience working remote preferred
  • Startup experience nice to have

Benefits:

  • Equity in a company valued at $4B!
  • Talented and collaborative coworkers who will both push and support you
  • Top 1% most competitive base salary
  • Medical, dental, vision benefits and 401(k) retirement plan
  • Take what you need vacation (and we really mean it)
  • 16 weeks maternity leave / 8 weeks paternity leave so you can truly bond with your child
  • Complimentary company membership
  • Sign-on Bonus!

Company DescriptionPurple Squirrel HR is a staffing agency representing the above client (see full job description). If you are interested in the above job, please apply today and we will promptly review your application and get in touch if it looks like a fit!

items.content:
Sr. Mobile Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: 3D Printing, Dental, Retail
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Private
Company: SmileDirectClub | Nashville, TN

Remote details

Office Location: Nashville, TN. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

ios
swift
https://smiledirectclub.com

Job description

We're SmileDirectClub, and we believe everyone deserves a smile they'll love. We also believe that you deserve a job you'll love. Good thing you found us, and we found you. At SmileDirectClub, we're all about empowering transformation. We want people to become more confident in how they look, how they feel, and how they think. So we're spreading smiles and positivity all over the country.It's no small task. That's why we're looking for energetic, passionate, and confident team members who can help turn frowns into life-changing grins. Are you up for it?SmileDirectClub is looking for a Senior Mobile Developer - iOS responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of iOS devices including mobile phones and tablet computers. The primary focus will be development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services. The job requires working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.Responsibilities: Design and build applications for the iOS platform preferably in Swift. Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization Implement key integrations related to analytics and data collectionIt will really make us smile if you have: Proficient with Swift and Cocoa Touch Experience with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, etc. Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end servicesRESTfulFamiliarity with Knowledge of other web technologies and UI/UX standards Understanding of Apple's design principles and interface guidelines Experience with performance and memory tuning with tools {{such as Instruments and Shark, depending on project needs}} Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications Knack for benchmarking and optimization Proficient understanding of Git Familiarity with continuous integrationBenefits of joining the club: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance 401K with match PTO Aligner and Whitening Benefit Collaborative work environment and positive cultureSmileDirectClub was founded on a simple belief: everyone deserves a smile they love. The Company is the first digital brand for straightening your smile, created after the realization that recent trends in 3D printing and telehealth could bring about disruptive change to the invisible aligner market by matching licensed professionals, a quality clear-aligner product, and customers together. By leveraging proprietary, cutting-edge technology, SmileDirectClub, LLC-affiliated dentists are providing greater access of care to consumers who couldn't otherwise afford orthodontic treatment to get a better smile.Want to learn more about us?Check out https://smiledirectclub.com
Apply now

Benefits

  • Medical
  • Dental
  • Vision
  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) Matching
  • PTO
  • Personal time
  • Catered lunches
  • Team building
  • Aligner discount for employees

items.content:
Sr. Mobile Developer (React Native)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Automotive
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Public
Company: O'Reilly Auto Parts | Springfield, MO

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Springfield, MO. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

ios
android
cocoa
react-native
java

Job description

Responsibilities:

  • Design and build advanced applications for the iOS & Android platform
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
  • Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability
  • Work on bug fixing and improving application performance
  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
  • What we look for in our developers:
  • Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
  • 5 or more years experience in software development with at least 5 years in mobile iOS and/or Android development
  • Successfully developed & deployed one or more native iOS app and/or Android app that showcases a rich, interactive user interface
  • Extensive programming experience in Java, Cocoa Touch, & Objective-C.
  • Knowledge of UI and animation frameworks, Xamarin, touch user interface, and MVP (minimum viable product) application design
  • Strong object-oriented skills including design, coding, and testing patterns
  • Experience with third-party libraries and APIs
  • Working knowledge of the general mobile landscape, architectures, trends, and emerging technologies

Awesome skills to have, but not required:

  • UI/UX design skills
  • Experience developing mobile web applications (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
  • Experience with image recognition software
  • Experience with server-side technologies and frameworks
  • This is a full-time opportunity; Monday-Friday, 8 a.m.-5 p.m.

About our team:

  • We create and customize 90% of our applications in house
  • We are a “work family”! We have fun together and support each other
  • We respect a healthy work-life balance
  • The team keeps open communication through different outlets – video conferencing, team messaging applications, and daily scrums/stand-up meetings
  • Our managers really value collaboration between team members and encourage developers to bring forth creative problem-solving ideas from both a technical and functional aspect

Growth within our teams at O’Reilly Auto Parts:

  • We have several career paths, whether you want to be a manager, project manager, or stay technical – there’s a documented growth plan to help you follow the path you choose
  • We want to grow our people – we help to make you better by providing training for both technical and professional development
  • We look to promote from within – O’Reilly is diligent to promote from within our organization with qualified team members
Apply now

About O'Reilly Auto Parts

O'Reilly Auto Parts is a Fortune 500 company with 59 straight years of continuous growth and over 73,000 team members at more than 4,600 stores and 26 distribution centers in 44 states. We are determined to be the leader in the auto parts industry and believe that our team members are the most important asset in our business.

Benefits

  • Diverse tech stacks and cross-training
  • Work/life balance
  • Team member discounts
  • Competitive compensation
  • Competitive benefits package
  • 401K
  • Paid vacation
  • Remote work
  • Collaborative and solution-orriented teams
  • Rapid growth

items.title: iOS Software Engineer at Universe (Brooklyn, NY)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=32, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=23, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
iOS Software Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Company: Universe | Brooklyn, NY

Remote details

Office Location: Brooklyn, NY. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

ios
swift
cloudkit
vapor
kitura

Job description

Build tools that empower and delight.

We believe that the web is better when more people are making it. Universe is built to empower everyone to create their own home on the internet.

We're looking for an iOS developer to help accelerate our mission. You'll take on tasks throughout the stack. You will expand the editor: adding new block types, more complex layouts, and more customizations for each block. You will help build tools that are easy for everyone to understand, so that buying a domain, setting up metadata, and adding pages are super simple. And you will advance our Magic Builder, a personalized design “assistant” that generates a unique site by asking you just a few questions.

Our app is native, taking advantage of the many frameworks Apple gives us. It is built entirely with Swift. The bulk of the user data is stored in CloudKit though we do maintain a few of our own APIs. We're hoping to convert those APIs from node.js to Swift soon, so experience with Vapor or Kitura is a bonus ;). We use programatic autolayout for the majority of our UI. We do believe in Unit Tests, but we don't have enough yet.

This is a full time position and 100% remote. Experience working remotely is definitely a bonus. We offer health benefits and generous vacation because everyone needs to recharge their batteries.

We're looking for someone sharp, internally-driven, and passionate about building powerful tools for everyone. 

Apply now

About Universe

Universe is the first website builder designed for mobile. In under a minute, anyone can make an awesome site on their phone with our breakthrough grid interface. We were part of YC Winter 2018, hit 170,000 sites created, and just closed our Series A.

items.content:
iOS Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Mobile Developer
Company: GigSmart | Denver, CO

Remote details

Office Location: Denver, CO. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

ios
objective-c
swift
api

Job description

We are looking for a skilled iOS developer who will join our team of talented engineers to design and help us to build the next generation of our mobile applications.

You should be able to write clean code and ensure your applications run properly. We also expect you to be passionate about pushing mobile technologies to the limits and perform well working in a dynamic environment.

iOS Developer responsibilities are:

  • Create and maintain advanced applications for the iOS platform

  • Work together with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.

  • Cover your code with unit tests to ensure robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.

  • Troubleshoot issues and bugs and improve application performance.

  • Explore, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.

iOS Developer requirements are:

  • 5+ years' experience of working on a iOS Developer position

  • At least one original iOS application is published in the app store

  • Significant experience in software development, including work with third-party libraries and APIs

  • Excellent knowledge of Swift.

  • Good experience with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, Core Graphics and Core Text

  • Good knowledge of the general mobile landscape, architectures, trends, and emerging technologies

  • Good understanding of the full mobile development life cycle

Apply now

About GigSmart

Headquartered in Denver, CO, GigSmart provides an experience that aims to create jobs for anyone and for companies everywhere, but most importantly is it our mission to create HOPE for those who may be otherwise lost without it. We are driven by our PASSION, CREATIVITY, INNOVATION but most importantly we are driven by HEART. The “Gig Economy” is one of the fastest growing spaces and “Gig Smart” is well positioned to thrive in the space.

items.content:
Senior iOS Mobile App Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Banking, Financial Technology, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 5k-10k people
Company type: Public
Company: Jack Henry & Associates, Inc.® | No office location

Technologies

ios
objective-c
iphone
swift

Job description

As an iOS Engineer on the Banno Platform at Jack Henry, you'll get the chance to make a real, positive impact on people's lives. Our mission is to give people the best possible experience they can have with their finances. We're doing this by reimagining the digital presence of financial institutions and building products that empower and delight their users. The iOS Mobile Application Engineer works on our mobile banking apps in close cooperation with our product design and api teams. iOS engineers are constantly keeping our app up-to-date with the newest development practices to offer exciting user experiences for highly secured data.

Skills & Requirements

  • At least 6 years of experience in a software engineering field.
  • At least 4 years combined programming experience with Objective C and/or Swift.
  • Successfully launched one or more apps on iTunes.
  • Experience with third-party libraries and APIs.

We Also Love to See

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science.
  • Strong object oriented design skills.
  • Experience working with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, Core Graphics and Core Text.
  • Experience designing custom Views and styles in accordance to design rules.
  • Working on a development team larger than 10 engineers.
  • Experience writing automated test cases for iOS providing adequate code coverage.
  • Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON.
  • Passion for true leadership and building an engineering culture.
  • Proven track record of technical leadership and ability to mentor less experienced engineers.
  • Working knowledge of the general mobile landscape, architectures, trends and emerging technologies.
  • Experience estimating, planning, staffing and tracking progress of projects
Apply now

About Jack Henry & Associates, Inc.®

We are committed to creativity, thoughtfulness, culture, and openness—the perfect place to make phenomenal products that have a big impact. Our work environment echoes a modern tech startup but we have the security and benefits of a large, publicly traded company. With an engineering team of near 100, we place high value on continued education and also contribute, and use, open source projects.

Our team is distributed and that means you can live and work wherever you want–as long as your work hours match US business hours. You’ll get the chance to choose your own tools, work with bleeding edge infrastructure technologies across the stack and contribute to products that are used by thousands of people.

Benefits

  • Flexible Work Hours
  • Remote Work Opportunities
  • Competitive Salaries
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • Awesome Health Insurance
  • Excellent PTO & Paid Holidays
  • Casual Business Attire
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Forbes Top 100 Best Places to Work 2017 (#2 in IT)
  • Computerworld's Best Places to Work in IT 2017

items.content:
iOS Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Mobile Developer
Company: MartianCraft | No office location

Technologies

ios
swift
cocoa

Job description

We are looking for a creative iOS software engineer to join our US-based remote company. We've been crafting custom Mac and iOS software for our clients for over ten years and are adding to our iOS engineering team. This position is open to U.S.-based candidates only. 

Responsibilities
- Design and build advanced applications in Swift and Objective-C
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
- Work with outside data sources and APIs
- Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability
- Work on bug fixing and improving application performance
- Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
- Cooperate with clients on best practices and approaches

Required Skills
- 5+ years of software development experience on Apple platforms
- Shipping a title to the iTunes App Store.
- Proficient with Swift, Cocoa, Cocoa Touch and Obj-C
- Ability to deliver solid work on tight deadlines while working remotely
- Must be a motivated team player able to work with minimal supervision
- Design-minded
- Strong attention to detail
- Highly motivated self starter
- macOS software development experience a plus
- OpenGL/OpenGL ES experience a plus

Preferred Skills & Experience
- Past remote work experience
- Previous small team experience
- Software consulting or freelancing experience

Details
- Located near Houston, TX, is a plus but not required. Must be able to travel 3-4 times a year to client site in Houston.
- This is a full time employment position
- Paid time off
- Sick leave
- Full medical, dental, and vision
- Matching 401(k)

Apply now

iOS Engineer at Stop, Breathe & Think, PBC

Santa Monica, Remote · Full Time

At Stop, Breathe & Think, we’re all passionate about helping the world find peace of mind every day and inspired to become the #1 emotional wellness brand for younger generations. We believe in hard work, kindness, dedication, accountability, having each others’ back and getting stuff done. If you share those values, we’d love to talk to you.

Applied
Apply to Stop, Breathe & Think, PBC
Add a message to Stop, Breathe & Think, PBC
Apply

Job Description

At Stop, Breathe & Think, our mission is to inspire the world to practice mental and emotional wellness every day. Stop, Breathe & Think is the mindfulness & meditation app that helps users navigate the ups and downs of life. We have a unique approach that allows users to check in with their emotions, and then recommends short, guided meditations, yoga and acupressure videos, tuned to how users feel. With over 3.5 million downloads, our personalized meditation and mindfulness experience was voted Best Health App, Webby People’s Voice Award and has been featured by the Today Show, Apple, GQ, Cosmopolitan and more.

Part of our team is based at our LA offices, and the rest work remotely. As we ramp up, we're looking for great engineers who are excited about building awesome mobile and voice based products and care about our mission. This is an opportunity to join an early stage company that has already built a large organic audience in a fast growing category and help define the user experience for the space.

We're looking for great iOS engineers who care about building apps that help people.

Responsibilities:

Work with UX designers, product managers, and company founders to plan and implement new features and capabilities

Expand our existing iOS applications, https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/id778848692 and https://itunes.apple.com/US/app/id1215758068

Build new apps from the ground up as we expand

Mentor interns and more junior developers

Work with our API engineers to plan and integrate server-side support for the apps and features you build

Requirements:

3+ years of experience developing iOS apps, with a focus on Swift

Can work in an agile, JIRA-based environment

Have shipped an app where you were a significant contributor

A bonus if you have experience with any of the following: Audio and video streaming, In-app purchases and subscriptions, Building apps for a large, diverse user base

On-site preferred, remote ok as long as you can work during US Pacific Time working hours.

Compensation: Competitive Salary + Equity

Skills
iOS Development, Objective-C, Swift
Compensation
$70K–$100K
0.0%–0.25%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to Stop, Breathe & Think, PBC
Apply

What We're Building

Our award winning app allows users to check in with how they are feeling and recommends short activities and guided meditations tuned to those emotions. The app has reached a large consumer appeal with over 2.8M organic downloads to date and connected at a deep level with the increasingly stress and anxiety prone 18-34 audience. Our vision is to become the #1 emotional wellness brand for younger generations. This means meeting their growing life needs as young adults and next generation parents. To that effect we launched an extension of our app targeted to children 5-10 years old, in partnership with Susan Kaiser Greenland, the author of Mindful Games.

Our personalized experience has been praised by users and the press. Stop, Breathe & Think has won the 2017 People’s Voice Webby Award for Best Health App and has been featured on the Today Show, as well as in Cosmopolitan, the LA Times, Fast Company, and many others.

Job Description

We're a social travel app that's growing exponentially. LookFwd is a revolutionary social application that let's you post your upcoming trips, see your friends trips, and chat about what's next! We have launched LookFwd 3.0 and are actively seeking a Lead iOS Developer.

Check us out!: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/lookfwd/id1117424939?mt=8

ABOUT US
- Invited to YC for final round interview last batch - top 7% of all startups that applied (Re-applying to next YC Batch)

- Founder/CEO - PwC Technical Project Manager
- PM - Engineer at Apple
- UX/UI - Mobile Engineer at Progressly
- CMO - Consumer Marketing at Vine

- Substantial previous iOS Mobile Development experience
- Highly productive, opinionated programmer with great product sense
- Excited to become a Co-Founder and work in an equity capacity
- Experience scaling a mobile application is a plus

BENEFITS:
- Substantial Equity Compensation in a growing startup
- Ability to work remotely
- Flexible Schedule
- Work alongside talented team

About LookFwd:

LookFwd is a Berkeley-based startup that was started at the Haas School of Business, and as such has significant resources available to it as it continues to grow. LookFwd currently has multiple mentors including a former Yahoo VP Media Executive and a Y-Combinator Alumnus.

Junior Mobile iOS at Phötage

Salt Lake City, Remote · Full Time
Phötage is a fully funded photo-merchanding company seeking to amp up its development team this summer, 2015. Based in Park City, UT, our company is fully distributed utilizing a git repository on BitBucket. We know developers like to work from home; however, if you want to escape the morbidity of summer life in the heat, come live and hack trailside in Park City's cool fresh mountain air--housing and moving stipend available. Read More

Phötage is a fully funded photo-merchanding company seeking to amp up its development team this summer, 2015. Based in Park City, UT, our company is fully distributed utilizing a git repository on BitBucket. We know developers like to work from home; however, if you want to escape the morbidity of summer life in the heat, come live and hack trailside in Park City's cool fresh mountain air--housing and moving stipend available.

Phötage is looking for talented development ninjas who are adept at learning or innovating software development techniques. We need front-end(iOS & Android) and back-end development ninjas who are familiar with photography and file sharing. We are open to part-time, full-time, and contract work.

Applied
Apply to Phötage
Add a message to Phötage
Apply

Job Description

We have an opening for a junior developer that has experience with iOS or Android development. You should be an ambitious fast learner with a desire to make cool stuff.

You should posses the following characteristics:
-Be an active listener and Communicator
-Have a passion for problem solving and learning
-A self manager

Coding Abilities:
-Ability to continue development on previously created X-Code projects, and posses the ability to develop a project from the ground up.
-Ability to engage in modular coding
-Understanding of basic data structures and analysis of algorithm.
-Basic HTTP and RESTful

Compensation
$35K–$60K
0.0%–0.5%

Not available

Phötage allows avid social media photographers to cherish their favorite memories through digital printing. The ubiquitous nature of camera's and social networks resulted in the exponential growth of digital image libraries. However, there is a better use for the vast image libraries than cloud storage! Creators need a streamlined process to produce their work in both the digital and physical world. Our goal is to create a profitable business delivering affordable photo merchandise to consumers who wish to beautify the physical world around them.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=12, mobile=42, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=51, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
iOS Engineer


Martiancraft


We are looking for a creative iOS software engineer to join our US-based remote company. We've been crafting custom Mac and iOS software for our clients for over ten years and are adding to our iOS engineering team. This position is open to U.S.-based candidates only. 

Responsibilities
- Design and build advanced applications in Swift and Objective-C
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
- Work with outside data sources and APIs
- Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability
- Work on bug fixing and improving application performance
- Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
- Cooperate with clients on best practices and approaches

Required Skills
- 5+ years of software development experience on Apple platforms
- Shipping a title to the iTunes App Store.
- Proficient with Swift, Cocoa, Cocoa Touch and Obj-C
- Ability to deliver solid work on tight deadlines while working remotely
- Must be a motivated team player able to work with minimal supervision
- Design-minded
- Strong attention to detail
- Highly motivated self starter
- macOS software development experience a plus
- OpenGL/OpenGL ES experience a plus

Preferred Skills & Experience
- Past remote work experience
- Previous small team experience
- Software consulting or freelancing experience

Details
- Located near Houston, TX, is a plus but not required. Must be able to travel 3-4 times a year to client site in Houston.
- This is a full time employment position
- Paid time off
- Sick leave
- Full medical, dental, and vision
- Matching 401(k)

See more jobs at Martiancraft

What We're Building

Weeserv enables hassle free access to a wide range of validated services like home repair, maintenance, plumbing, carpentry, electrical works, electronic goods repair, housekeeping services etc from the convenience of your home or office. We empower the customer by aggregating disparate services on a single platform, giving them the choice to choose among numerous service providers, based on other customer experiences, reviews etc.
The service providers are enlisted only after thoroughly vetting their credentials thus ensuring that the customer gets prompt, responsive, satisfactory, timely and quality service at low cost. We also provide access to odd services not accessible elsewhere. Although anyone who’d want to access services quickly and easily is a potential customer, Weeserv would especially be of immense value to working individuals and home makers who find it hard to devote time to the ordeal of finding a service provider and then following through until the task is completed.

What We're Building

Powered by AI, Blockchain and Big Data Analytics Open Health Network is a smart Patient Experience Management Platform. It enables healthcare organizations to rapidly create personalized chatbots, voice and mobile apps and gives enterprise level content management system to maintain features and content of chatbots, voice and mobile apps without programming. Blockchain technology is used to communicate data across all the players within healthcare ecosystem. Personalization, gamification and recommendation engines enable advanced functions across apps and chatbots. Predictive algorithms are deployable on a front end and interactive big data analytics dashboard on a back end. Apps developed on OHN platform are HIPAA compliant and have real time integration capabilities to EMRs/EHRs, devices and other systems.
Among our customers organizations such as American Heart Association, UCSF, Cornell, HHS, NIH, Harvard and more.

items.content:
Senior iOS Developer


Xapo


OVERVIEW


*

Location: Remote (Work from home anywhere in the world)





Xapo is seeking a Developer to join our mobile team. We need someone passionate about iOS and willing to work with first-class engineers around the world. This position can be done from anywhere: from your home, or from a co-working space, just anywhere in the world.


RESPONSIBILITIES

As an iOS Developer, you will be developing our mobile app that will enable thousands of people to spend their money on their cellphones. The impact of what you will help develop at Xapo will be life-changing for many people.

We are looking for passionate, enthusiastic and top quality engineers; if you think you have what it takes to help revolutionize the fin-tech future then come to join us!

See more jobs at Xapo

items.title: Gaia GPS | Junior Software Engineer | Focus on iOS | Full-time | www.gaiagps.com
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=6, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=6, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Gaia GPS | Junior Software Engineer | Focus on iOS | Full-time | www.gaiagps.com

Remote (So far: CA, PA, OR, SD, MT, OK, WA, WI)

Help build the future of outdoor mapping at Gaia GPS. We're looking to hire a developer who wants to work with a strong team and learn a lot. You'll join a 5-person dev team whose past experience includes Google, Facebook, Mapbox, and the founding of Gaia GPS.

This position starts with a base salary of $65K, and is our first explicitly junior hire. You'll be focused on iOS development at first.

We heavily favor candidates who do a lot outdoors.

You might be:

* a CS graduate with 0-1 years of experience

* a new-ish programmer who switched from a different profession

* an experienced developer, who hasn't been part of a strong product team

Lifestyle and Benefits

* We have the most flexible, remote work environment, which lets all of us balance family and other interests, with work.

* We offer 4 weeks of vacation, and another 12 paid holidays that can be shuffled around. We provide 2 months of paid maternity, 1 month of paid paternity, and additional unpaid leave.

* Non-salary financial benefits include bonuses based on company performance (you'll learn the formula while interviewing), health insurance, and 401K matching.

* We provide the best computers, monitors, tablets, and other home office equipment. We reimburse home internet and mobile phone bills. We comp expenses for any sort of books or other materials for learning.

* We have a retreat every 9 months, alternating with and without families (past ones include Tahoe, Zion, Rocky Mountain NP, camping, backcountry skiing, etc), to hang-out and mingle the remote team.

~~~ jobs@gaiagps.com ~~~
